---
id: create-custom-field-batch
title: "Create custom fields (batch)"
description: "Creates one or more custom field instances in bulk. This endpoint differs from [POST /api/v1.0/custom-fields/types/new](/docs/api/custom-fields/create-custom-field-type) which creates custom field **types**. This operation creates custom field **instances** that apply custom field types to specific entity types (Assets, Tickets, Users, etc.)."
sidebar_label: "Create custom fields (batch)"
hide_title: true

import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";
import RequestSchema from "@theme/RequestSchema";
import StatusCodes from "@theme/StatusCodes";
import OperationTabs from "@theme/OperationTabs";
import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";
import Heading from "@theme/Heading";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Create custom fields (batch)"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/custom-fields/new"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Creates one or more custom field instances in bulk. This endpoint differs from [POST /api/v1.0/custom-fields/types/new](/docs/api/custom-fields/create-custom-field-type) which creates custom field **types**. This operation creates custom field **instances** that apply custom field types to specific entity types (Assets, Tickets, Users, etc.).

**Key Differences**:
- This endpoint creates custom field instances (relationships between field types and entity types)
- The single-type creation endpoint creates the field type definitions themselves
- Use this for applying existing field types to entities or creating new instances

**Prerequisites**:
1. **CustomFieldTypeId** - Obtain from [POST /api/v1.0/custom-fields/types](/docs/api/custom-fields/search-custom-field-types) or create via [POST /api/v1.0/custom-fields/types/new](/docs/api/custom-fields/create-custom-field-type)
2. **EntityTypeId** - Standard entity type UUIDs (Assets, Tickets, Users, etc.) - available from site configuration

**Workflow Example** (Adding a warranty field to assets):
1. Get or create the custom field type for "Warranty Expiration Date"
2. Call this endpoint to create the custom field instance: [POST /api/v1.0/custom-fields/new](/docs/api/custom-fields/create-custom-field-batch) with `CustomFieldTypeId`, `EntityTypeId` for Assets, and configuration
3. The custom field is now available for all assets

**Minimal Required Fields**: CustomFieldTypeId, EntityTypeId

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

Standard entity types include Assets (d7bda5de-e6a2-e711-80c2-0004ffa00010), Tickets (7eceb87e-e6a2-e711-80c2-0004ffa00010), Users (8eceb87e-e6a2-e711-80c2-0004ffa00010), etc."},"IsRequired":{"type":"boolean","description":"When true, users must provide a value for this custom field on the target entity type.","default":false,"example":false},"IsReadOnly":{"type":"boolean","description":"When true, users cannot modify the custom field value after it has been set.","default":false,"example":false},"IsHidden":{"type":"boolean","description":"When true, the custom field is hidden from standard UI views.","default":false,"example":false},"DisplayOrder":{"type":"integer","description":"Ordering applied when rendering this field relative to others on the same entity type.","default":0,"example":0},"FilterSetId":{"type":"string","format":"uuid","nullable":true,"description":"Optional filter set ID that controls when this field is displayed. >
  
</RequestSchema>
